concept.title: Foundational Typing Rules
concept.shortdesc: Understand the basic typing rules for operating a typewriter efficiently and correctly.

conbody.p: Before you start typing on a typewriter, it is important to know the basic rules that help you type neatly and accurately. These rules apply to both manual and electric typewriters.
Use the Shift key to type capital letters or symbols that appear on the upper part of a key. Hold down the Shift key with one hand while pressing the desired letter or symbol with the other hand.

At the end of each line, use the Return Lever (or Carriage Return key on electric models) to move the carriage back to the starting position and advance the paper to a new line. This action allows you to continue typing on the next line without overlapping text.
Press the Space Bar once between words to create even spacing. Avoid pressing the space bar multiple times, as typewriters produce fixed-width spacing that already ensures uniform gaps between words.
Following these simple typing rules helps maintain a clean, readable document and improves your overall typing rhythm and accuracy.
